content.description:
The data in the graph display the similarity rates for identical and fraternal twins1 who share a diagnosis of major depressive disorder.

Similarity Rates for Identical and Fraternal Twins Sharing a Diagnosis of Major Depression

All values are approximate.

The Degree of Genetic Similarity data for the 2 bars are as follows:

Identical Twins (100%): 66

Fraternal Twins (50%): 15

1: Identical twins are genetically identical. Fraternal twins are only as genetically similar as any sibling pair.↩
content.question: According to the graph, the explanation for depressive disorders is most consistent with which of the following psychological approaches?

skill.text: 3.A: Identify psychology-related concepts in descriptions or representations of data.
